message.content:
cs.NE, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.SY

The paper discusses the capacity of randomly connected recurrent linear networks for performing short term memory (STM) and leverages results from compressed sensing. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The paper also uses the restricted isometry property (RIP) to provide non-asymptotic recovery guarantees, which falls under cs.IT (Information Theory). Additionally, the paper discusses the impact of network characteristics on system capacity, which is related to cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also explores the optimal recovery length for network STM systems, which is related to cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the paper discusses different network topologies that can yield optimal STM capacity, which falls under cs.SY (Systems and Control).
